metadata.title: CVE-2018-16554 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The ProcessGpsInfo function of the gpsinfo.c file of jhead 3.00 may allow aremote attacker to cause a denial-of-service attack or unspecified otherimpact via a malicious JPEG file, because of inconsistency between floatand double in a sprintf format string during TAG_GPS_ALT handling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jhead - 1:3.00-8+deb9u1build.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jhead package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.00-8+deb9u1build.16.04.1').
